title: UC Davis Seroepidemiology Research Group (UCD-SeRG)
text: Our research focuses on infectious disease surveillance and diagnostics with a focus on enteric infections.

title: Publications
text:

Here is a list of publications generated from the BibTeX file.


# If using R, list references using the `RefManageR` package
library(RefManageR)
bib <- ReadBib("publications.bib")
NoCite(bib = bib, "*")
PrintBibliography(bib, .opts = list(style = "text"))

[1] M. E. Carey, W. R. MacWright, J. Im, et al. "The Surveillance for
Enteric Fever in Asia Project (SEAP), Severe Typhoid Fever Surveillance
in Africa (SETA), Surveillance of Enteric Fever in India (SEFI), and
Strategic Typhoid Alliance Across Africa and Asia (STRATAA)
Population-based Enteric Fever Studies: A Review of Methodological
Similarities and Differences". In: _Clinical Infectious Diseases_
71.Supplement_2 (Jul. 2020), p. S102–S110. ISSN: 1537-6591. DOI:
10.1093/cid/ciaa367. <http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/cid/ciaa367>.

[2] D. O. Garrett, A. T. Longley, K. Aiemjoy, et al. "Incidence of
typhoid and paratyphoid fever in Bangladesh, Nepal, and Pakistan:
results of the Surveillance for Enteric Fever in Asia Project". In:
_The Lancet Global Health_ 10.7 (Jul. 2022), p. e978–e988. ISSN:
2214-109X. DOI: 10.1016/s2214-109x(22)00119-x.
<http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/S2214-109X(22)00119-X>.

[3] D. Morrison, O. Laeyendecker, and R. Brookmeyer. "Cross‐sectional
HIV incidence estimation in an evolving epidemic". In: _Statistics in
Medicine_ 38.19 (May. 2019), p. 3614–3627. ISSN: 1097-0258. DOI:
10.1002/sim.8196. <http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/sim.8196>.
